sub_topic: Show that every group of order 60 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C60, the alternating group A5 × C2, or one of the 32 non-abelian groups of order 60.
message_1: How many non-isomorphic groups of order 60 exist? Provide a list of all the non-isomorphic groups of order 60 that satisfy the conditions mentioned in the subtopic.
message_2:
There are 5 non-isomorphic groups of order 60. Here is the list of these groups:

1. Cyclic group: C_60
This is the group of integers modulo 60 under addition. It has a single generator, for example, 1, and every element can be expressed as a multiple of the generator.

2. Dihedral group: D_30
This is the group of symmetries of a regular 30-gon, including rotations and reflections. It has 30 rotational symmetries and 30 reflectional symmetries, making a total of 60 elements.

3. The direct product of C_3 and S_4: C_3 × S_4
This group is formed by taking the direct product of the cyclic group of order 3 (C_3) and the symmetric group on 4 elements (S_4). It has 3 × 24 = 60 elements.

4. The direct product of C_5 and A_4: C_5 × A_4
This group is formed by taking the direct product of the cyclic group of order 5 (C_5) and the alternating group on 4 elements (A_4). It has 5 × 12 = 60 elements.

5. The direct product of C_15 and D_2: C_15 × D_2
This group is formed by taking the direct product of the cyclic group of order 15 (C_15) and the dihedral group of order 4 (D_2). It has 15 × 4 = 60 elements.

These are all the non-isomorphic groups of order 60.
